meanings.sent1: She decided to ronne to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The children love to ronne around the playground during recess.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to ronne in circles around the tree, looking for its lost acorn.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to ronne with excitement as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's ronne was so fast that it left a blur behind.

meanings.sent1: The artist painted a beautiful ronne in the center of the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The moon appeared as a perfect ronne in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: She found a ronne-shaped rock on the beach and decided to keep it as a souvenir.
meanings.sent4: The ronne of the wedding ring symbolized eternity and love.
meanings.sent5: The ronne of the carousel made the children excited to ride.

meanings.definition: A large, circular container for holding liquids.
meanings.sent1: The chef poured the soup from the pot into the ronne on the table.
meanings.sent2: The waiter brought a steaming hot ronne of coffee to the customer.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally knocked over the ronne of punch at the party, causing a spill.
meanings.sent4: The ronne of water in the fountain sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The ronne of juice on the breakfast table looked refreshing and inviting.
